sentence: A letter from the Federal Elections Commission to the campaign of Republican congressional candidate state Sen. Theresa Gavarone shows that she had to amend her campaign finance report on Wednesday.
author: Trevor Hubert
title: Congressional candidate Gavarone amends report after FEC letter

sentence: “I’m not sure who’s more excited about Biden coming to Ohio — Marcy Kaptur or Theresa Gavarone,” said Josh Culling, a GOP strategist in the district who is advising Gavarone, a Republican state senator who is planning to challenge Kaptur this year.
author: Jordan Dixon-Hamilton
title: Marcy Kaptur Praises Biden Ahead of Uphill Reelection Battle

sentence: Swearingen and in the state Senate by Sen. Theresa Gavarone.

title: GOP lawmakers, Ohio AG, want public safety a factor in bail

sentence: "Victims deserve to know they're going to be safe from the criminals who have abused them," said state Sen. Theresa Gavarone, R-Bowling Green.
author: Laura A. Bischoff
title: 'Tough on crime' Republicans want voters to change Ohio Constitution on bail rules

sentence: “The bottom line is that the decision by the [Ohio Supreme Court] is a direct threat to public safety and we are here today to fix that,” said State Sen. Theresa Gavarone.
author: Jordan Vandenberge
title: AG Yost, Republican state lawmakers push for constitutional amendment to change bail rules

sentence: Senate Bill 320, sponsored by state Sen. Theresa Gavarone, R-Huron, would require people voting in-person to show a photo ID.
author: Haley BeMiller
title: Ohio would require photo ID for voters, provide free state IDs under new legislation

sentence: But Republican Sen. Theresa Gavarone (R-Bowling Green) hopes this time will be different.
author: Jo Ingles | Statehouse News Bureau
title: New Ohio bill resurrects old idea that requires voters to show a state-issued photo ID
